Name: Monopoly: The BFG
Description:
Join Sophie and The BFG on their adventures across the world saving England from nasty giants, with the help of her Majester the Queenie! Visit London, Giant country and of course, the Queen’s Palace, as one of six original playing pieces. Will you have a phizzwizard or a trogglehumper? Will you pay for the bus and taxi? Will you collect snozzcumber and frobscottle? This duper squiffling monopoly game brings the magical new movie into your own home!

—description from the publisher

Name: Dice Forge: Chimera
Description:
This card replaces another one from the Hydra deck. This card has no effect, you only gain victory points.

During the setup, if you are playing with the Hydra cards, replace one of the Hydra cards with the promotional card in question.
The cards will be placed in the pile in ascending order:
Hydra > Harpies > Chimera > Mother of monsters

This card is given out by the publisher during official initiations to Dice Forge.

Name: Hound
Description:
Today is a wonderful day — also a good day for hunting! The hunter Rex is very excited to be out with his dogs, and he is ready for hunting. Wish him good luck!

Hound is played in multiple rounds until one player obtains 10 points and wins. Players can use different dogs for their special abilities and to hunt other animals. Who will be the best hunter? Just try!

Name: Red Eagles Air War over the Kuban Peninsula, 1943
Description:
The Red Air Force challenged the Luftwaffe in a series of air battles over the Kuban Bridgehead in early 1943. The lessons learned by the Soviet airmen would help them gain air superiority on the Eastern Front later that year.

This is a two player game in the Air Wars series. Units represent one or more Soviet air regiments or German Gruppen. Aircraft include IL-2 Sturmoviks, Lend-Lease P-39s, Bf-109s, He-177s, and more. Bombing missions are needed to take out ground targets, while fighters fly escort or interception missions. The map covers the area from Rostov to Sevastopol.

Each player has a set of cards providing additional capabilities, improved logistics, and special orders from the high command. Victory goes to the player hitting the right targets and protecting friendly assets.

—description from the publisher

Name: Coronel & the Falkland Islands
Description:
Dreadnoughts & Battlewagons provides a low complexity ship-to-ship combat system allowing players to explore historical and hypothetical encounters during the age of the super dreadnought.

Each counter depicts a single ship or the information markers required to denote a ship’s damage, special ship movement, or configuration. Ships are rated for weight of fire, range, structural integrity, maneuver, speed, and special capabilities.

The Battle of Coronel simulates the 1 November 1914 meeting engagement off the coast of Chile between the German East Asia Squadron of Vice Admiral von Spee and the British 4th Cruiser Squadron under Rear Admiral Cradock. The historical outcome was the loss of Cradock’s largest ships.

The Battle of Falkland Islands simulates the encounter between von Spee’s squadron and a much more powerful British naval force on 8 December 1914. This time the British exacted a heavy revenge, virtually obliterating the German squadron.

—description from the publisher

Name: River Plate & Denmark Strait
Description:
Dreadnoughts & Battlewagons provides a low complexity ship-to-ship combat system allowing players to explore historical and hypothetical encounters during the age of the super dreadnought.

Each counter depicts a single ship or the information markers required to denote a ship’s damage, special ship movement, or configuration. Ships are rated for weight of fire, range, structural integrity, maneuver, speed, and special capabilities.

The Battle of the River Plate simulates the naval encounter between the German Panzerschiff Admiral Graf Spee and the British Royal Navy Cruisers HMS Exeter, Ajax, and Achilles on 13 December 1939. The historical outcome led the Graf Spee to seek shelter in Montevideo, Uruguay, where she was subsequently scuttled.

The Battle of Denmark Strait simulates the encounter between the German battleship Bismarck and a British squadron on 24 May 1941. The historical outcome sent HMS Hood to the bottom and damaged HMS Prince of Wales, but Bismarck suffered seemingly minor damage that would lead to her eventual destruction.

—description from the publisher

Name: Baffled
Description:
Baffled is the ultimate memory game. You have just 60 seconds to memorise the positions of the 12 symbol tiles... BUT prepare to be Baffled as they constantly swap and change positions around the board! Fun for all the family, who can survive the Baffled board the longest... will it be you?

—description from the publisher

Name: BarBEARian Battlegrounds: Whistle While You Work Promo
Description:
This promo is a new upgrade card for the game BarBEARian Battlegrounds.

This upgrade card costs 2 faith, 1 food, and 1 ore. It's ability is: "Gain 1 resource token of any type each time your bears clash on the Battleground."

The card is numbered UP-05.

This promo was distributed in Game Trade Magazine #221 (July 2018).

Name: Defenders of Dragonfell
Description:
Defenders of Dragonfell is a cooperative “Tower Defence” style eurogame, where a team of 1-6 unique heroes (aged 10+) join the fight to protect their village against waves of monsters of ever increasing difficulty.

Attacking is dice based and a few bad rolls can quickly turn the tide of battle. To triumph the team must balance: using actions to attack the hoards (which earns them gold), with investing in building defensive towers (which takes several actions, but provides additional attacks each round).

Defenders of Dragonfell is an Action Point based game. Heroes can either, move, shoot or build to make their way across the map and start killing off the attacking wave of monsters. Killing monsters earns the hero gold, which they use to buy one of the unique tower types. Each tower works differently and by placing them strategically, powerful combinations can be created to save Dragonfell.

—description from the publisher

Name: Family Trade
Description:
Family Trade is a financial training card game for 2 to 4 players (6 years old and up).
Players can enjoy 3 different play styles based on each rule.
The object is to collect sets of trade cards with the same picture.
3 cards with the same picture are counted as 1 set. The first player, who complete sets of cards according to the rule, can get money based on the Paytable.
Finally, a player who earns the most money is a winner.

Game mode 1)MARKET MAKE
Who is the smartest player?
In the financial market, many smart speculators are competing with one another on their own reliable theory and building the market every day. 
Who can earn the most revenue at the fixed market rate? This is a game mode that represents the difficulty in the financial trading.

Game mode 2)GOD OF MARKET
Who is loved by the god of market?
In the financial market, the competition between speculators and unexpected fluctuations affect the performance. Therefore, just thinking is not enough to gain the revenue. The market experts also have good luck. 
Who is the player loved by the god of market? This is a game mode that tests your financial luck.

Game mode 3)BATTLE ROYALE MARKET
Who is a speedster at the market?
The technology evolution accelerates the transactions and achieves the executions at 0.001 second in the financial market. Therefore, the financial trade is restricted in some countries. 
A battle ends in a blink. The trade items decrease as the rounds progress. Who is the survivor in such situation?
This is a game mode that represents the dynamism of the financial market.

—description from the publisher

Name: Trickerion: Collector's Edition
Description:
Trickerion - Legends of Illusion is a thematic, medium-heavy Euro-style game of rival stage illusionists. In this game, you are a Victorian-era magician, with a team of apprentices and specialists you can assign to various tasks using worker placement and simultaneous action selection. 
These tasks include collecting magical components, expanding your assortment of Tricks, and preparing magnificent magic shows in the Theater for you to perform at the end of each round. Performances can earn you money, but ultimately, you are in it for Fame: the more famous you are, the better Tricks you can learn, and the Magician with the most Fame points will win the game.
The Collector's Edition, is only available during Kickstarter campaign.

Contains:

- Trickerion - Legends of Illusion base game
- Trickerion - Dahlgaard's Academy expansion
- Trickerion - Dahlgaard's Gifts add-on pack
- Module - Dark Alley
- Module - Duel of Magicians
- Module - Magicians Powers
- Uniquely numbered alternate art box - velvet Box Lid
- Revised core rulebook
- Two sets of Metal Coins
- Custom linen pouches
- All unlocked stretch goals

Stretch Goals:

- Solo Mode
- 4 new Magicians
- Double Decker Plastic Trays
- 2 Academy Shillings
- Dawn of Technology mini expansion
- Extra Special Assignment cards, Extra Prophecies, Extra Dark Alley cards, extra Class Room and Practice Room tiles, etc.
- Mystery at the Academy unlocks
- Double sided Alternate Art Main Board
- Workshop Contraptions Module

Name: Sword & Sorcery: Darkness Falls
Description:
The darkness is covering all the land, the cemetery gates are no longer closed, and the immortal heroes must now face enemies who ignore pain and never sleep… the undead army! Skeletons, vampires and werewolves appear everywhere... Will the heroes accomplish their mission and finally free their souls from the soul gems' spell?

In Sword & Sorcery: Darkness Falls, the heroes' path brings them toward their final destiny. Complete the heroes' epic campaign across the quests of this expansion, recreating the final act of their legendary saga. High soulrank powers, treasures, and challenging enemies await you!

Darkness Falls includes twenty new lethal enemies: Succubi, Skeletons, Death Knights, and Werewolves, two new, powerful master enemies, 14 new modular boards, new Act II cards for items, traps, treasures, events and enemies.

The campaign is played through seven new high-level quests, using the innovative combination of Storybook, Book of Secrets and cards to create a challenging, story-driven climax to the Immortal Souls campaign.

This expansion contains ACT II of III.

1833 is a card game where the objective is to establish the most valuable railroad network by creating routes between various North American cities of the 19th Century.  Players take turns drawing cards and building their railroad connections.  Players' resources are limited by number of cards he may hold in his hand, but may be increased by building increasing levels of routes.  Route levels (size) are determined by the type of locomotive used for that route.  Stockpiling resources (cards) is tricky and dangerous because getting rid of unwanted cards is not trivial.  Players may also collect corporation cards which increase the value of the player's routes connected to that corporation's home city.  Holding corporation cards count against a player's hand limit; representing the built-in cost of that corporation card. Private company cards (representing privately held railroads) may be used to connect otherwise unconnected cities, but at a cost to the value of the route for which they are used.

—description from the publisher

Name: Lost Artifact
Description:
According to an ancient map which you, one of the most famous archaeologists of our century, found in the last archaeological site you excavated, there is an ancient lost artifact in Vaca Mountains somewhere in the rainforests of South America. You have to use all your skills and experience to reach the mountains and find the Lost Artifact.

The object of the game is to reach Vaca Mountains and to have at least 2 determination to find the Lost Artifact. You are going to move through the numbered locations on the map, exploring the rainforests, by drawing exploration cards and resolving them.

2018 Solitaire Print And Play Contest Results:
1st Place - Best Easy To Build Game
2nd Place - Best Game Playable on an Airline Seat Tray 
3rd Place - Best Graphic Design
3rd Place - Best Original Artwork

—description from the designer

Name: Ominoes: Hieroglyphs
Description:
Ominoes: Hieroglyphs is the second game in the Ominoverse adding to the Best Abstract Game of UK Games Expo 2017 - OMINOES.

Ominoes: Hieroglyphs is a tile laying, tile flipping game where players are racing to complete their temple ahead of everyone else.
The temple is made of five parts each of which is bought and activated using blessing tokens. The blessing tokens are gained by placing tiles on the Frieze of Ominotep in groups of four or more. Once a group is formed it earns the active player a blessing of that symbol, plus any bonus blessings from being adjacent to special altars. Once score the tiles of that group flip to the other side and a second scoring may be possible. If a second group scores then those tiles are removed - but without breaking the Frieze.

Place Tiles. Score Blessings. Build Temples.

Name: Terraforming Mars: Colonies
Description:
Our world has widened before us. Corporations expand their operations to all corners of the solar system in pursuit of minerals and resources. Most places are not suited for terraforming, but building colonies may greatly improve your income and your possibilities in achieving that higher goal — the terraforming of Mars. Send your trade fleet to distant moons! Colonize the clouds of Jupiter! And let your Earth assets propel you to success!

Terraforming Mars: Colonies, an expansion for Terraforming Mars that can be played with only the base game or with any combination of expansions, lets you visit the outer solar system. It features colony tiles where you can build colonies and send your trade fleet. It also includes new cards and corporations.

Name: Die Legenden von Andor: Die verschollenen Legenden "Alte Geister"
Description:
After the victory over the dragon, new and exciting adventures await the heroes of Andor. With the help of the people from the West, they rebuild the burned-down homesteads. They come across Arbaks, the Andoric spirits of the forest. Soon they face powerful, previously unknown enemies: an ice demon, an ancient earth spirit, and the Chief of the Skrale. Finally, the heroes in the interior of the Gray Mountains air a long-kept secret.

The Die Legenden von Andor: Die verschollenen Legenden expansion includes three new legends for use with the base game. With the expansion New Heroes or Dark Heroes, you can play with up to six players.

Name: That's So Wrong: Caveman Edition
Description:
That's So Wrong: Caveman Edition is the first in what is hoped to be a long series of strategic party games that you can learn quickly, but spend years mastering. The game system offers so much substance that you can play them forever and ever until you die and pass them on to your children. Traditional standalone games usually make you pick one: they're either easy to pick up, but don't have enough gameplay to keep experienced players engaged; or they're loaded with depth, but tough to get into.  That's So Wrong: Caveman edition was designed to keep experienced gamers entertained, while maintaining simplicity so new players can jump right in.

Players start the game by building their tribe from a random set of 4 caveman. Once all players have done this, players can send their caveman out to the "wild" to fetch items which in turn help make your tribe stronger. Conflicts happen when your caveman and another player's choose the same item, cave woman, event, caves to live in, or dinosaurs to hunt. If this happens conflicts begin and are resolved by looking at the text of the card. Follow the simple instructions to determine the winner. Winners take the prized possessions back to their tribe.

Certain cavemen and items are better at accomplishing different tasks. Some cavemen are good at hunting, some are good at finding love with the cave-ladies, and others are less practical. Some are even perfect for winning conflicts.

Cavemen who successfully accomplish their mission by being uncontested or winning a conflict become exhausted and they (and their spoils of discovery) are unable to be sent back out again until the following turn. Managing who is exhausted and how many cards are in your hand (which can be expanded with the discovery of a new home/cave) is important to claim victory. As your tribe grows rich with items, powerful dinosaur hunts, cave-woman, and pets you'll be able to win more conflicts and cause more mayhem for other players.

At the end of the game, players add up the value of the cards they've collected and a winner may emerge.

—description from the designer

Name: Pub Battles: Waterloo
Description:
Waterloo  is a Military Strategy Board Game where Allied players attempt to stop Napoleon in his final battle at Waterloo.

The British under Wellington are outnumbered but they hold good terrain and Prussian reinforcements are constantly streaming into the battle.  The French must strike quickly and shatter Wellington before the growing Allied numbers become overwhelming.

Name: Colleges Against Insanity
Description:
In this higher education-themed game, deal seven White Cards to each player. The person who most recently saw a squirrel begins as the Dean of Cards and plays an orange card. The Dean of Cards then reads the Orange card out loud. Everyone else answers the question or fills in the blank by passing one White Card, face down, to the Dean of Cards. The Dean of Cards shares the answers with the group, chooses the funniest card, and awards one .edu point to the person who played it. The person to the left of the Dean of Cards becomes the new Dean of Cards and everyone draws back up to seven White Cards. The game ends when all White cards have been played, or at least two players realize they have important work to do. The winner has the most .edu points at the end.

—description from the publisher

Name: Arcanem
Description:
Quick mage battles in magical arena. Each combat round lasts 5 minutes, in total there are 4 rounds that take place in a magic arena that levitates over boiling lava and that each turn is falling apart. Each player controls a magician with their own powers and abilities, your magician enters with 3 charged spells that when used are exhausted but can be recharged during the battle, each round is exchanged wizards and you start a new round with a different wizard until you try them all.

—description from the designer

Name: World of Warcraft Trading Card Game: Molten Core Raid Deck
Description:
Includes ten epic bosses, from Lucifron to Ragnaros the Firelord.

Raid Decks represent struggles involving large numbers of players against epic foes. Raid Decks are specially designed pre-constructed products used for a cooperative experience. They combine elements from the World of Warcraft (the team-based questing), and Dungeons & Dragons (the Raid Master). One player, the Raid Master controls all monsters and foes, while 3-5 other players control the characters participating in the raid.

A Raid Deck typically contains epic boss cards, decks for the boss characters, tokens to represent minions, custom rules for the raid, and a treasure pack, intended as a reward for players who are victorious in the raid. The treasure pack contains holofoils and sometimes contains a random insertion of a loot card. Upper Deck Entertainment also made treasure packs available from their UDE points store, although the cards in these packs are not holofoil.

Name: World of Warcraft Trading Card Game: Magtheridon's Lair Raid Deck
Description:
Contains the Pit Lord Magtheridon, his shadow channelers, and the cubes required to interact with him.

Raid Decks represent struggles involving large numbers of players against epic foes. Raid Decks are specially designed pre-constructed products used for a cooperative experience. They combine elements from the World of Warcraft (the team-based questing), and Dungeons & Dragons (the Raid Master). One player, the Raid Master controls all monsters and foes, while 3-5 other players control the characters participating in the raid.

A Raid Deck typically contains epic boss cards, decks for the boss characters, tokens to represent minions, custom rules for the raid, and a treasure pack, intended as a reward for players who are victorious in the raid. The treasure pack contains holofoils and sometimes contains a random insertion of a loot card. Upper Deck Entertainment also made treasure packs available from their UDE points store, although the cards in these packs are not holofoil.

Name: Lästerschwester
Description: The malicious gossips meet and a hotbed of rumors swirls…who will it catch today?

Name: Catch It!
Description:
In Catch It!, each player has a basket on their head, and to start the game the two players throw the twenty balls in the air, trying to catch as many white balls as possible. As the balls land, both players try to grab them, throwing the white balls (underhanded) into their own basket and the red balls (again, underhanded) in their opponent's basket. Feel free to dodge those unwanted balls! Once all the balls have placed in the nets, or the players collapse from exhaustion, players tally their scores — number of white balls minus number of red — to see who wins.

With more than two players, each pairing of players competes once to see who wins the most rounds.

Name: Atlantic Adventure Race Game
Description:
British board game celebrating Bob Manry's epic 1965 solo Atlantic crossing in his 13.5 ft. sloop Tinkerbelle.

The board depicts a map of the Atlantic Ocean, showing various possible routes from Falmouth, Mass. USA to Falmouth, Cornwall England.

A simple roll and move game for up to four players with numerous hazards and course changes along the way.

Name: Schnecken Checken
Description:
Tonight it’s again all about hitting on girls - of course with the best chat-up lines in the world. Who can come up with the best Quote?

—description from the publisher

Name: Kroko Dinner
Description:
Kroko Dinner! Who can collect the fish quickest with the crocodile mask?

Description provided by publisher

Name: Elefantastico
Description:
Balance on the circus elephant! In this exciting stacking game, players use finger tip control to try and place small sticks onto the elephant’s back.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Name: One to 9
Description: Play cards at the right time to grab stars in One to 9. Try not to let other players grab stars first by completing rows ahead of you. The first player to collect three stars wins!

Name: Suited
Description:
This brilliantly clever card game features all four suits; clubs, hearts, diamonds and spades, but each one appears in four different colours and multiple times on each card. It's all about judging the probability that the next player will be able to fulfill a challenge you lay down for them, based on the suits and colours that appear on their cards. On your turn, you play TWO cards. The first has to meet the criteria of a challenge set for you by the previous player. The second sets the challenge for the next player. You'll want to force them to use their most powerful cards early in the game, but make sure you hang on to your own powerful cards and use them at the right time. Hold onto game-changing cards for too long and you could inadvertently blow everything! This outstanding game will confound your expectations and keep you on your toes!

—description from the publisher

Name: Lustprinzip
Description:
Good communication with one’s partner is important - providing one can also converse clearly with them. Who is best able to re-phrase ambiguous Terms?

—description from the publisher (translated)

Name: Tabaluga: Die große Reise
Description:
It's your turn to roll the dice and move forward with your character, or back.

If you land on a motif that you have not collected yet, you may take a matching tile.

The game is exciting until the end: whoever arrives in grassland must check that he has the correct tiles. And if not, then the player must start over.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Name: X: Ganz schön knifflig!
Description:
X: Ganz schön knifflig! is a roll-and-write game.  On a player's turn, they roll four dice, then pair them off in sets of two, score them on a score sheet, and allow the non-active players to choose and score a single pair for themselves.

The goal of the players is to tick rows completely because only then they can score points.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Name: Sowas fragt man nicht!
Description:
In turn, every player gets a piquant question such as: "Who has ever peed in the shower?"

Who does not want to answer, can fit up to two times - who fits for the third time, loses and is punished!

So, dress warmly, in this game you may learn more about your fellow players than you actually love!

Name: Zack Zack
Description:
In Zack Zack, Players compete to be the first to form a series of words conforming to specific subject cards using only the letters rolled that round on the three letter dice.

Every round, players reveal a new subject card, and then roll three letter dice and a single number die. The players then must be the first to form a amount of words denoted by the number die, containing letters shown on the letter dice. Whomever is first wins the round, and receives a subject card as a point.

After a player hits a pre-determined goal of subject cards, then that player wins!

Name: Pub Battles: Monmouth
Description:
Monmouth is a Military Strategy Board Game where 2 players fight this desperate rearguard action from the American Revolution.

This Entry Level game is a perfect, low cost way to check out the Pub Battles system.  The small map and few blocks come with an affordable price tag;  but you still get the highly acclaimed Pub Battles features:

Short Rules
Quick Play Time
Tense Action
Monmouth also makes a great demo game for players new to wargaming.

—description from the publisher

Name: Nut So Fast: Nutty Poses Promo Card Pack
Description:
A set of 5 new Nutty Poses for your game of Nut So Fast. Some of these new poses actually require you to grab a nut token when a number comes up - kind of a double head fake.

—description from the publisher

Name: Story Game Journey into Space
Description:
Roll the dice, and check the number and colour on your Astro board. Try to mark each spaceship’s trail with planet tokens and be the one who shouts “Blast off” first. This modern classic keeps the players on their toes right to the end!


     Huge content with Astro board and over 100 Planet tokens!
     The game play is simple but addictive.
     The story really comes alive in the game!


—description from the publisher

Name: Angry Birds: Power Cards
Description:
Angry Birds: Power Cards starts out like a game of Top Trumps however the player is also building a structure with cards they win and then need to find a pig to launch at.

To build structures: When a player wins a card they can build a structure with the card they won.  Building supplies are wood, ice and stone, and your entire structure needs to be the same materiel.

Slingshot round:  After a pig has been added to a players structure, players read out the slingshot value on their cards and see who wins.

Last player with cards wins.

Name: Albedo: Space Pirates!
Description:
Albedo: Space Pirates! features innovations for the Albedo base game like spaceship cards that can be rotated to retrofit them and simultaneous action selection resulting in minimum downtime and a uniform game length. In addition, the expansion includes new planet cards, a new faction, and new mechanisms like the planetary fighter garrison.

The base game is needed in order to use the expansion.

—description from designer

Name: VOID
Description:
VOID is a work of art created for the "Is This a Game?" exhibition held in the Akihabara section of Tokyo from May 29 to June 3, 2018.

VOID includes many strange tiles, along with dice and a marker, but it contains no specific rules on how to use these components to play a game. Well, sort of — you use these materials as you wish to create a game scene, then you take a photo or video of that fabricated game scene and upload it to whatever social networking services seem appropriate for you and your fellow players using the hashtag #voidgame. Whoever receives the most "likes" on their post wins.

Name: Seinfeld Trivia Card Game
Description:
Have fun with television's funniest group of friends in this take-anywhere Seinfeld trivia game. See how much you remember about Jerry, Elaine, George and Kramer, and their friends and families as you try to be the first player to collect 5 cards and win.

Every card features two questions, including one extra-challenging question for the super fans of the show.

Features episodes from all nine seasons.

Contents: 149 game cards with 298 trivia questions, rules card.

Note: Not the same as Seinfeld Trivia Game which features 600 questions on 300 cards as well as a game board and other components.

Name: Top Gamer
Description:
In Top Gamer every player wants to be the best boardgames' gamer. This game uses Games Cards system and simulates boardgaming.

Every player trains his brain by playing board games during game parties. Playing in every game gives some experience to him, and player chooses which his level of game type or game mechanism to raise. After 2 game parties all players try to win the next 8 players (bots replace absent players) game tournament. To win tournament player must have higher total of his levels for type and mechanism of tournament game. The best 3 players of tournament  get 3, 2 or 1 victory points. After 10th round player with the most points is top gamer.

Name: Royal Roundup
Description:
The medieval strategy game!

Giddy-up! The castle is under attack! Choose a horse and follow the winding paths to save the price, princess, and precious treasures - each with their own point values. Race along the paths until all of the people and treasures are safe from invaders. The one who rescues the most treasure points wins the game!

Name: Trickerion: Dawn of Technology
Description:
Dawn of Technology contains two modules for Trickerion: the Contraptions, and the Signature Tricks.

Thanks to Magoria's recent technological achievements, Magicians can now enhance their Workshops with up to four Contraptions, unique to their magic school. Contraptions can be assembled as a Workshop Action, for the cost of 1 Coin per Contraption already in place. They can be used any time during a player's turn by turning them to their inactive side, and receiving a bonus based on the player's Magic school - in the above example, the Mechanical Contraption, the Generator, supplies the city with electricity, netting its owner a steady income of Coins.

Each Contraption has a more powerful effect than the one below it. At the end of a round, each Contraption with enough Shards next to it can be reactivated and used again next turn - this follows the similar principle as the Magician Powers module (which is playable with Contraptions). The highest-level Contraptions are so breathtaking that simply reactivating them will earn you some Fame!

The Contraptions module includes 16 Contraptions with 4 unique illustrations, printed on 3mm blackcore cardboard, and 4 board extensions.

When you learn a Trick from your own school, you may choose to learn your Signature Trick instead (if you meet its Fame threshold). Each Signature Trick “upgrades” a Trick from the original set: for example, Professor Bernard can learn his Legendary Shark Tank signature trick instead of the “ordinary” Water Tank Escape. If a Signature Trick is learned, the standard version is removed from the deck. And if an opponent already learned its standard version, your Signature Trick no longer has a Fame Threshold!

Signature Tricks have the same component requirements as their standard version, but they also require Contraptions to function: the higher their Fame threshold, the more Contraptions you have to use when you prepare them. However, in return, not only do these Tricks have better numbers (higher Yield, more Trick Markers, etc.), but they also have a special power: for example, The Legendary Shark Tank’s Trick markers can be aligned freely in the Theater, meaning that you’ll always be able to create Links with it.

This expansion is contained in the Collector's edition and will also be available by itself, at least from the publisher's website.

—description from designer

Name: Nonstop Dungeon
Description:
Shake up the 36 dungeon cubes, flip the timer, uncover and compete! In this epic real time tabletop dungeon crawler players have four minutes to draw routes through the dungeon on their 6x6 grids on their score sheets. After, players add up their scores from all grids they've filled out this round and the highest total score wins! players gain more points per run the more spaces they cross and the more enemies they defeat and treasures they collect.

—description from the publisher

Name: Dungeon Furry
Description:
In this turn based follow up to the real time dungeon crawler Nonstop Dungeon take control of your favorite cat character and control them in the dungeon with your personal video game controller player mat. Use the DPAD sticks to claim routes on the map. Complete quests by collecting items in the dungeon to earn upgrades for your controller such as a joystick or shoulder buttons. Steal Dragon Eggs to gain VP or purchase quests. When a player has filled up their personal tv screen with quests or when all dragon eggs are claimed from the bank the game is over with the highest scoring player winning!

—description from the publisher

Name: Please Pass the Mustard!
Description:
Please Pass the Mustard! is a fast-action card game for 2 to 6 players, ages 8 and up, in which hungry eaters select the foods they want to eat and then shop for the mustards that go with them.

The first player to place five different foods on his or her "dishes" and also play the five paired mustards wins the game.

Players roll dice to determine an action for their turn, and then play and draw cards representing various dishes, mustards, wild cards and ketchup, which is used to ruin other players dishes.

Name: Total Monstrosities the Card Game: Original Orange
Description:
"Total Monstrosities the Card Game - Original Orange" is a game for 1 – 6 players that takes roughly 20 minutes.

The aim of the game is to win 10 Totalmon Cards before your opponents. You win Totalmon cards by having the strongest overall Totalmon at the end of a round. Use Buff and Support Cards to raise your total, or better yet, Mutate your Totalmon into stronger Totalmon to gain the edge.

—description from the publisher

Name: Siatka
Description:
Point! Set! Match!

Play volleyball match on the board. Receive the ball, pass it, attack and score a point!
“Siatka” is a dynamic game that simulates a volleyball match. Players decide how to play a ball, use individual players' skills or... to surprise opponent with quick attack from the second line.

The box contains simple basic rules for beginners and advanced rules for experienced players.

Name: Park Dinozaurów
Description:
A cooperative game for small children!

You are going to the Dinosaur Park with your family. But what is this? Dinosaurs scattered around the park and the meteor shower has just been announced on the radio.
Help the dinosaurs return to their catwalks before a cosmic storm begins.

Dinosaur Park is a game that evolves with children - after defeating the basic level you can struggle with more difficult tasks.

Name: Na ratunek!
Description:
Fire! Car accident! Robbery!

In the game Na ratunek! (To the rescue!), players send their emergency vehicles to various accidents. They earn a victory point for each successful action. Players train memory, perception and learn how to react in dangerous situations.
 "Na ratunek!” is a game from the series "Pocket game for pocket money", which contains interesting family games for children 6 +.

Name: Where's the Money, Lebowski?
Description:
The Official Loaded Questions Party Game based on The Big Lebowski

HILARIOUS GAMEPLAY - In this adult party game for 4-6 players, choose your favorite answer and guess 'who wrote which answer' to 180 open-ended Loaded Questions inspired by The Big Lebowski

NO TRIVIA - Whether you have seen the cult classic film 0, 1 or 100 times, your enjoyment level and chance of winning are not an issue. It’s just a party game, man.

EASY RULES - This is not 'Nam, there are rules! But these rules are simple, man, so you can enjoy your Game Night right after opening the box.

ORIGINAL ARTWORK - All of the quality components, including the large format game cards, feature beautiful, original artwork by Dave Perillo.

OFFICIAL LICENSE - The Dude would approve.

—description from the publisher

Name: Killing Lee Garvin
Description:
A 3-6 player card game about killing real-world game designer Lee Garvin. Or saving him, you can win either way. Basic play involves color combinations of amusingly illustrated Harm and Help cards to manipulate the overall state of play.

Get rid of all the Harm tokens you have and you win. If someone else has too many, Lee bites the dust, and the winner is the one with the fewest tokens. So, you can either frame someone else for Lee's demise if you think you will end the round with the best game position, or simply try to improve your own position without making too many enemies.

—description from the publisher

Name: Loaded Questions: Adult Version
Description:
The hilarious adult party version of the classic ‘who said what’ game.

Features 308 new and classic Adult Loaded Questions, all new design, and added game play features/components for a laughter-filled Game Night

Questions include: What is an instant mood killer? / What word sounds dirty…but isn’t? / What TV show would you watch if it included full nudity

Let’s Say It’s Your Turn…


     Flick the spinner, pick the next card, and read aloud the corresponding question. (Let’s say the question is “What would you NOT want to find in your partner’s bedside drawer?)
     All other players write a personal answer for the question on their answer sheets, which are then collected and read aloud by the player to your right.
     After hearing all of the answers, choose your favorite and match which player wrote which answer. Match correctly and pick one of the highly desirable VIP cards. The player who wrote your favorite answer also wins one of these cards. The first lucky player to collect 8 VIP cards wins the game!


2017 UPDATE: How To Win and VIP cards are updated in this version

—description from the publisher

Name: Loaded Questions The Game
Description:
The Family/Friends Version of the Classic Game of 'Who Said What'

If you never owned this classic game of 'who wrote what' or need to update your older copy, this NEW edition is the one to get.

Features 880 new and classic Loaded Questions, all new design, and added game play features for a lifetime of memorable game nights.

Questions include: What is something you only need one of? / What word would people never use to describe you? / What is your most useless talent?

This core Loaded Questions game is perfect for families and adults.

Let’s Say It’s Your Turn…


     Read aloud the Loaded Question that matches the colored space you’re on. (Let’s say the question is “What is something you would love to do every day of your life?)
     All other players write a personal answer for the question on their answer sheets, which are collected and read aloud by the player to your right.
     After hearing all of the answers, match which player wrote which answer. Advance one space for every correct match. The first player to reach the WIN space wins the game!


—description from the publisher

Name: Mickell
Description:
Work on 3 words simultaneously.

You will take cards one at a time, adding each card to one of 3 lines. Try to turn each line into a word. Score much more for longer words.

Will you just aim for the easy points, or will you burn cards waiting for a higher-scoring word?

This game can be played by many people simultaneously. If you have a 'caller' telling everyone what card to play next, it becomes Muckell. After all, 'many a mickell makes a muckell'.

—description from the designer

Name: Darkness Comes Rattling: War of the Spirits
Description:
In War of the Spirits, an expansion for the cooperative board game, Darkness Comes Rattling, players must stop their world from being torn asunder by the powerful, world-eating serpent. With a new and challenging end game, new obstacles to overcome, and new boons to discover, players are tasked with saving both the physical and spirit worlds before Darkness grows hungry once more.

The Darkness Comes Rattling: War of the Spirits expansion bundle includes:
- 52 Vision Quest cards
- 6 Body of the Beast cards (and 1 Eater of Stars card)
- 18 Unleashed Event cards
- 4 New Legendary Item Cards
- 4 Blessings Cards

Description on DriveThruRPG website

War of the Spirits is a digital-only expansion for Darkness Comes Rattling. It includes a quest system for the game that allow the players to take on Darkness in a new way, adding new difficulties to the game.

Players can now take on Darkness directly as a group, foregoing venturing inside the snake to free the Sun. To do this, they must gain the Winds' Blessings and keep the world pure. The better the players do, the weaker Darkness will be when it is forced to manifest on Tallil.

The game rules for War of the Spirits can be found below, and the components can be printed on-demand from DriveThruRPG.

Description from publisher

Name: Mansions of Madness: Second Edition – Horrific Journeys: Expansion
Description:
In the skies above the Atlantic, a dirigible's peaceful journey is interrupted by a bloody act of revenge and an oncoming storm. On the sea far below, a treacherous saboteur plants the explosives that will sink a ship. In the New England countryside, a train billows black smoke, desperately fleeing an unimaginable threat.

Horrific Journeys is a deluxe expansion for Mansions of Madness which unlocks three thrilling scenarios that take four new investigators far from Arkham, solving mysteries aboard a bustling transatlantic airship, a luxury ocean liner, and a scenic countryside train. With new map tiles, puzzles, monsters, and mythos events, these brave men and women must contend with hideous amphibian monstrocities and interdimensional creatures tearing holes in the fabric of reality all with the knowledge that one wrong move can destroy the very vessels they are trying to protect! In order to arrive at their destinations, the investigator of Arkham must first survive their journey!

—description from the publisher
Families: Series: Arkham Horror Files (Fantasy Flight Games)

Name: Don't Count Your Chickens!
Description: 12 eggs are placed on a plastic straw base in a circle with the smaller end pointed to the center.  Each player takes turns grabbing an egg while attempting to avoid unbalancing the chicken and awakening her.  The last player to not awaken the chicken is the winner.

Name: Détective Mathéo
Description:
Détective Mathéo is a mathematics card game. The box contains three games: additions, subtractions, and multiplications.

Cards are displaying calculations on one side and results on the other side.

Players choose a card set, shuffle the cards, and put the pile between them with the calculations visible. They flip over the topmost card which now shows results and place this card next to the pile. The aim is to be the first to find the only calculations whose result is on the result card.

The player who first finds the right pair gives the result aloud and then the associated calculation. If they are correct, he then wins the "Results" card which is worth one point. If they are wrong, the are out for the rest of that round.

At the end of the game, one card will be left on the table, the player who has won the most card is the winner of the game.

Name: Badly Drawn Death
Description:
Badly Drawn Death is a quick, brutal and stupid battle card game where you try to kill your friends in silly ways. For 2-5 players, the aim of the game is to be the last person standing to win. You do this by building your defences and attacking your opponents.

72 unique cards make up the game, each featuring a humorous and sometimes downright outrageous drawing. From the Cake of Death to the Badly Driven Tank, you'll be laughing as you rain death down on all of your friends!

You'll also find plenty of opportunities for picking on other players back-stabbing at the opportune moment. Badly Drawn Death is both brutal and unexpected in its gameplay. You never know what will happen next and nobody is ever safe!

—description from the designer

Name: Blank: Blankdemic
Description:
What happens when a legendary game designer takes one of their most famous releases and transforms it into an expansion for everyone's favorite quick-playing card game? We asked Matt Leacock (and his daughter Colleen) to create the first Designer Expansion for Blank and are now proud to present Blank: Blankdemic!

Take the cards from this booster pack and add them to your copy of Blank, then get ready to save the world in a very different way! Deal with diseases, ready your roles, and make it your game... all over again!

Blankdemic comes with twenty new Rules and Game Cards to add to your copy of the base game, as well as more blank Rules Cards to customize yourself. Profits from sales of the expansion also go to the designers' charity of choice, in this case Medecins sans Frontiers.

Name: Millennium Blades: Doomtown Reloaded Promo Pack
Description:
This is a crossover set of 6 new Millennium Blades cards featuring characters and art from Doomtown: Reloaded.

This is also included in Crossovers 2 Mini-Expansion #7.

Name: Mortain Aug44:  Old Hickory vs. the SS
Description:
My devilish little print-and-play regimental/kampfgruppe level game about the desperate German counterattack in southern Normandy - "Normandy's Switzerland" - west toward Avranches and the sea against U.S. 1st Army units, to cut off our (especially Patton's 3rd Army's) breakout into all France.  18 8-hour turns, 7-12Aug44.  23 U.S. (eventually) + 4 tac air vs. 12 or 13 German units.  1 mile/1.6 kilometers per hex and pro-defense combat results, because of the dense, compartmentalizing terrain, which was still bocage as well.  Includes divisional and corps artillery and Allied fighterbomber/Jaegerbomber/"Jabo" airpower.  There is the 50% possibility of German General der Panzertruppen Gerhard Graf von Schwerin's historical (patriotic) anti-Hitler treachery, which held back 116. PzDiv in the north for 48 crucial hours and profoundly crippled Fall (Operation) Luettich.

Allied player must choose to exit units in the south for victory points or use them instead to stop the German schwerpunkten (from advancing and getting victory points).  This is a tight, nerve-wracking game requiring both players to claw for every victory point.

If (von Schwerin has been relieved/arrested and) 116. PzDiv is unleashed, the U.S. player must patiently and enduringly play the long game to wear down German units and catch up by then eliminating them.

—description from the designer

Name: Arkham Horror: The Card Game – The Depths of Yoth: Mythos Pack
Description:
The Depths of Yoth is the fifth Mythos Pack in The Forgotten Age cycle for Arkham Horror: The Card Game.

Following the events of The City of Archives, your team of investigators find yourselves trapped deep in the of the Earth and the only way out is...down. Your mission to protect humanity continues, but the threats to your life increase with each level of the descent. There is no telling what monsters have grown in these dark caverns and now pursue your team, but you cannot look back, or you are surely lost.

This Mythos Pack features new player cards to customize your investigators' decks and treacherous encounter cards to immerse you in the peril of your investigation.

—description from the publisher
Families: Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)
Game: Arkham Horror – The Card Game
Game: Arkham Horror TCG – The Forgotten Age
Series: Arkham Horror Files (Fantasy Flight Games)

Name: Devil Core Tactics: Strategy RPG Card Wars
Description:
Devil Core Tactics is a diceless strategy RPG card game for 2 players. Build your battlefield, summon your allies and enter into the war of the gods as you battle against each other. This is the core set and includes everything needed to get started.

This set includes :

     Sacred Cross Deck x30 Cards (In Custom Sacred Cross Tuckbox)
     Crimson Nobles Deck x30 Cards (In Custom Crimson Nobles Tuckbox)
     8x10 Sinosha Battlemaps x30 (15 Per Deck) (Double Sided)
     Devil Core Tactics : Rules
     Battle Record Sheet x2


—description from the designer

Name: Deck Derby: A Dead Seas Racing Game
Description:
Deck Derby is a fast paced racing game in the Dead Seas fantasy realm. Racers use unique dice drafting mechanics to upgrade and win!

In Deck Derby each racer has a "Favored Number" and a "Favored Color". All players roll their dice and place them into a dice pool. One at a time players draft the dice there racers need to perform actions. Some of these actions won't require any certain number or color, some will require your preferred number, some will require you preferred color, and for game changing abilities the player must have both their preferred number and color. Racers will use their actions to speed themselves up, slow down other racers, or attack if the race is close.

—description from the publisher

Name: Snowdonia: Deluxe Master Set
Description:
Snowdonia is a competitive or solitaire worker placement game, lovingly crafted around the idea of building railways in Wales, and – with multiple other scenarios – around the world.

Snowdonia: Deluxe Master Set contains  the Snowdonia base game as well as all previously released promo cards and scenarios, along with five new scenarios: The Bluebell Railway, The Qinghai-Tibet Railway, The Mount Hakone Electric Railway, The Wye Valley Tourer, and The Malta Railway. This set also includes an automa (Botdell), designed by Dávid Turczi, along with a number of designer trains which are new to the Deluxe Master Set.

Contains:
     
Snowdonia
Snowdonia: Bayerische Zugspitzbahn
Snowdonia: Britannia Bridge
Snowdonia: Candace Camille
Snowdonia: Card 31 of 30
Snowdonia: Essen 2012 Promo Cards
Snowdonia: Jungfraubahn & Mount Washington
Snowdonia: Lost Train Promo Card
Snowdonia: Mrs Larkin's Washing Machine
Snowdonia: Pen-y-Gwryd Hotel
Snowdonia: Puffing Billy
Snowdonia: Rolling Stock #1
Snowdonia: Seasons
Snowdonia: Supply Wagon/Cannon
Snowdonia: The Battlepuppy Express
Snowdonia: The Daffodil Line (the full set of cards found in the first print run; there were less cards for it in the Trans-Australian Railway & The Daffodil Line printing)
Snowdonia: The Lord Mayor's State Coach
Snowdonia: The Necropolis Railway & Neuhauser Bockerlbahn
Snowdonia: The North Pole & The Great Bridge Scrapyard Promo Tile
Snowdonia: The Siege of Petersburg / The Channel Tunnel 1881
Snowdonia: Trans-Australian Railway & The Daffodil Line
Snowdonia: Wagons Expansion

Also includes promo cards that were previously print and play only (these were Kickstarter stretch goals):
Princess Margaret Rose
The Bought At Auction Loco
No. 11 Prototype Engine
The Breakdown Crane
The Utility Loco
Santa's Sleigh
Krampus
The Camoflaged Loco

The Great Old One
The Coal Train
The Downbound Train
Sen's Train
The Scarecrow
The Falkland Island Express
The Birthday Train
Terraforming Engine

Thomas the W*** Engine
The Unreliable Engine
The Coal Train
The Luggage (and this one will be altered, sorry)
The Son of God
The Guvnor's Engine
The Love Train
Conveyor Belt.

AND everything else...EVERYTHING Tony ever published/designed for campaigns/scribbled on envelopes etc!
Families: Versions & Editions: Big Box Versions of Individual Games

Name: Dragon Watcher: The Card Game – Ancient Artifacts
Description:
Ancient Artifacts is the story of rival Dracoaeologists who are racing to find artifacts that can be used to control ancient stone dragons.

There are 20 new equipment cards in the set and many of the new dragons gain special abilities based on the equipment cards you have.

The set is 54 cards (no repeats!) with their own box and requires the base game to play.

Name: 1676: Miniatures Skirmish Battles in the Time of King Philip's War
Description:
Pilgrim cavalry charges! Desperate attacks on fortified settlements! Daring ambushes! These are just a few of the skirmishes you can fight with 1676 - a tabletop miniatures game set in New England during the Native American uprising that became known as King Philip’s War.

The types of conflicts that occurred in King Philip’s War were usually small skirmishes that can be represented on a tabletop with these rules. You can play a native war party or a force from the Army of the United Colonies. If you want to add "fell creatures," magic, & (gasp!) European powers, there is a supplement available with these additions (Mad Dogs & Englishmen).

The core rules are provided in only 5 pages. They are simple & straightforward. Simple die rolls - using 6- & 8-sided dice - are used to resolve combat & other actions. Most actions have the same target for success, so they are resolved quickly.

You can use one of the pre-made "armies" provided in a second PDF (Part Two), or can create your own balanced forces using a simple point build system. Part Two includes unit cards, sample army lists, & all the tokens you’ll need. Alternatively, premade Unit cards, Command cards, & (Mis)Fortune cards are now available from The Game Crafter.

Both books are illustrated with photographs of figures from Brigade Games' King Philip's War line. With these figures (supplemented by those from other manufacturers), you can now easily field beautiful forces in miniature to represent the combatants.

So heed the call to arms! Your colony or tribe is depending on you!

Name: A Formidable Enemy: Rules for Miniature Skirmishes in The French & Indian War
Description:
A Formidable Enemy is a fast-paced skirmish game set in the French & Indian War. There are two PDF downloads included with your purchase: a 36 page rulebook, and a 45 page book of army lists and rosters. You can use one of the six premade armies, or create your own force with a comprehensive point system. The game has a historical "feel" through the use of Assets specific to different types of characters & units. Optional "otherworldly" rules are included to take advantage of some of the outstanding figures available for this period. Color photographs of figures from Conquest Miniatures, Eureka Miniatures, AW Miniatures, & Warlord Games, as well as structures by Acheson Creations (all used with permission) illustrate both documents.

Part One contains the game rules (summarized in a 4-page Quick Reference), Assets to personalize your troops (Abilities & Characteristics, Weapons, Artillery, Special Unit Members, Equipment, Vehicles, Animals, & Structures), Liabilities, Otherworldly Assets (including Divine Interventions), Templates, Markers & Tokens, & optional Event Cards.

Part Two contains brief historical information, Army Lists, and Unit Cards for the Indians, French, British, Canadians, & American Colonials. There is also information on Bears, Dogs, Zombyes, & a few other optional (but fun!) non-historical additions to the game (inspired mainly by figures from Conquest Miniatures). There are six sample armies, & information about how to create your own troops & armies.

Name: Squatch the Board Game
Description:
Challenge your friends and be the first to catch the Sasquatch. This is a fast paced game where each player races to collect 3 supply cards corresponding with 1 of the 4 locations on the board. On a turn, a player may play as many cards from their hand as they like, then draw back up to 3 cards.

Supply cards, when drawn, are immediately placed face up on the discard pile. The first player to grab the corresponding territory totem wins that supply card.

Once you have collected enough supply cards you must move yourself and Sasquatch onto the correct location in order to catch him and win the game. Watch out, other players will steal your supplies, rotate the board, and other things to mess up your plans.

Name: The Barmaid's Tale
Description:
The Barmaid's Tale takes place in the Ratcatcher's Rest, one of Tinderbox's more colorful establishments, and features a game known to the locals as "Pass the Buck".

The game is introduced via a story a barmaid at the Ratcatchers relates in an interview, in an obvious parody of "The Canterbury Tales". The account details the exploits of a hapless party of adventurers returning to Tinderbox to face their patron after a failed quest. Needing to set an example, but realizing that even bad help is hard to find, their benefactor decides that only one of them will be held accountable. But whose fault was it? It's at this point that the players step in to, well, pass the buck.

The Barmaid's Tale is a simple ten-minute social strategy game of blame and bribery for 4-6 players.

Name: So Long, My World: Remnants of the Moon
Description:
"You owe something to the Moon. Therefore, it demands a sacrifice. Its pale radiance leads you to new, hidden memories. It is said that only the remnants of the Moon will have an open path laid before them. Do you belong to that ancestry?"

The first add on is a mainly thematic expansion, cards are focused on the value of choice and sacrifice. Your willingness to sacrifice yourself without expecting anything in return will be tested.

A new type of card, the Purpose card, is introduced by this expansion. Each player starts with one and has to fulfill its requests (usually spending a Feeling on a different Vision card each turn) to win extra Insight points at the end of the game. These cards can also be part of the karma chain, so use them carefully!

Offering a new scenario for solo mode, Remnants of the Moon is compatible with solo mode.

Name: So Long, My World: Wells of the Sun
Description:
"Mankind has always considered the sun as the source of all life. People adored the sun, ignoring the horrible truth that lurks behind it. Only some cultures had the courage to face the truth.

A truth so simple yet so horrific. What gives life also brings death. Life is evil."

This expansion gives a dramatic insight into the narrative of So Long, My World. Cruel decisions await. Use the Marks of Sol to bring destruction and reveal the true, savage nature of mankind.

It adds more Remnant, Events and Gestalt cards, pushing the narrative to even more adult, horrific and potentially disturbing themes. In a different way from the core game, this expansion is suggested only for 18+ players due to its vivid contents.

Name: Art Deck
Description:
Art Deck is a drawing game for 2-6 players. Players are dealt cards from a deck of instructional sentence fragments ("what do to do", "how to do it" and "something that makes it difficult") and deal out a starting sentence with one of each. (eg. "Draw eyes / across half the page / without taking your marker off the page.")

On your turn, you play a card onto the sentence, replacing the previous one in that position, and then contribute to a communal drawing, obeying the sentence's instruction.

The game continues until someone plays a "sign your name" card and signs the artwork, completing it.

Name: The Trader's Tale
Description:
Now a day of discount sales across Tinderbox, the original "Ruby Tuesday" was so named after a famous quest to recover the ruby hoard of the Salamander King. This quest saw every adventurer in Tinderbox racing to equip themselves and be the first to embark on the adventure, making a lot of traders very wealthy in the process.

The Trader's Tale is a fast-paced trading game in which you compete to control the game board and equip your party of adventurers.

Name: Zoot Suit
Description:
Zoot Suit is a speedy game of card matching.  You have to get rid of nine cards by matching each previously-played card by suit, by color, by background pattern or with a WILD card. It's fast, it's fun, and it's a fantastic five-minute family game for kids and adults.

—description from the back of the box

Name: Roll to the Top!: Special Challenges Pack
Description:
5 Special Challenges pads:
- 30 Wooden House sheets: With long or wide squares.
- 30 Art to the Top sheets: Long, wide and both longer&wider squares.
- 30 Heydar Center sheets: Partly Increasing mode and partly Decreasing mode.
- 30 Roll Your Own sheets: Make your own Challenge, random or by own choice, by striking out some of 60 squares.
- 30 Cube House sheets: With start spaces at different heights

Name: Roll to the Top!: Roll Through Africa
Description:
Backers' exclusive Challenge pad: 
30 Roll Through Africa sheets
Preparation: The starting player first chooses the starting area. All players place a '1' in the selected starting area.
Each area that you fill in must be adjacent to a filled area.

Name: Yip, Yip, Yip: eine nervige Erweiterung
Description:
This expansion offers new arrangements and event cards. Some arrangements include new mechanics, feeding back into player actions.

—user summary

Du dachtest, noch chaotischer geht nicht? Falsch gedacht: Mit Yip, Yip, Yip wirken sich die Arrangements auch auf deine Aktionen aus. Und die neuen Ereigniskarten halten ein paar hübsche Überraschungen bereit ...

Jetzt gilt umso mehr: Nicht die Nerven verlieren!

Eine besonders nervige Erweiterung für das Unicante-Spiel mit 34 Arrangements und 16 Ereignissen.

—description from the back of the box (German)

Name: Football Dice: World Edition
Description:
Football Dice is an exciting dice game based around national football teams. There are 16 teams to collect.

In each packet is one team, and each team has 3 dice; a defence die, a midfield die and an attack die. All dice are different colours relating to the teams colours, and include flag faces and cultural references. You can play with one set of dice by sharing them but it is better with a friend with another team.

Once you have decided who goes first and how long you are going to play for, we suggest 2 minutes, 1 player starts by rolling their defence die. Then you just follow the commands on the dice, and just like in real football, see who can score the most goals! If you roll a "flag face" you simply roll again.

—description from the publisher

Name: Earthly Scenarios
Description:
The Earthly Scenarios game probes how adventurous you think you are, and how adventurous your friends & family think you are with its worldly content on real life events, occurrences and cultural traditions going on around the globe.

Players take turns reading a scenario aloud to the other players and then the other players try to predict how likely the reader is to participate in that scenario. Example: There is a Bridge made of Glass in China, would you walk across it? Predict correctly and points are gained. Every time 3 points are accumulated, an Earthly Card can be drawn, which contain certain clauses on them that can be used on yourself to get ahead, or against other players to keep them down. First player to 30 points wins!

Intuition of your peers is put to the test, as the most instinctive player is the most likely to win. Best part is learning about dozens of interesting, hilarious & thought provoking facts along the way.

-description from designer

Name: Cards Against South Africa
Description:
Cards Against Humanity is a party game in which one player reads a "fill-in-the-blank" statement from a black card, and the others complete it by answering with their funniest white card… which usually includes words or phrases typically deemed as offensive, risque or politically incorrect. Whoever has the funniest white card wins.

Cards Against South Africa is a localised version of Cards Against Humanity.

Name: CQB: Futuristic Skirmish Miniatures Rules
Description:
Welcome to CQB, a complete self-standing set of science fiction miniatures rules for depicting Close-Quarter Battle! Inspired by the combat actions of the United States Space Marine Corps and other units featured in Skirmisher Publishing's popular and bestselling USMSC FM 7-22: Space Boarding Operations universal sourcebook, CQB replicates gritty, intense, close-quarter skirmishes fought on board starships, space stations, and industrial settings of Earth’s colonial worlds.

—description from the publisher

Name: Der letzte springt
Description: Each player has to get his 3 meeples from start to finish. There is a colored track for each player and movement is determined by a die. Only the last of the 3 meeples of a player may move and only if it can get to a space that isn't occupied by one of the 2 meeples before it. The first player to get all 3 meeples into the finish space wins the game.

Name: 1827: The Grand Game of American Railways
Description: A large scale 18xx game by Federico Vellani, covering all or part of the 48 contiguous states, USA Game has seven scenarios, and maps in east and west sections as 1825 and 1829 were.

Name: 18Moon
Description: An 18xx game on the surface of the moon. Incorporates a few interesting differences as a result and is a unique map.

Name: Desfases
Description:
In this game, players use their die as a timer; this timer is fed by coins, whose values indicate the amount of turns it will take to trigger a score. Scoring depends on the facing of the tiles around the pawns on the board – which is constantly changing, since the tiles rotate on each turn unless they are pinned by the pawns. This way, dice and tiles are constantly moving in and out of phase with each other.

The game will be won by the player with the highest score after all the timers have stopped and there are no more coins left to feed them.

Name: 18NE
Description: An 18xx game focused on the Northeast US, designed by Rich Northey. Covers New England and parts of NY, NJ, and Pennsylvania.

Name: 18Oki
Description: One of the 18xx games set in Japan, this one with a historically accurate map based on the island of Okinawa. Shorter play than most 18xx games.

Name: Monkey Balance Tower
Description: Monkey Balance Tower is a game of strategy, luck and skill for 2-8 players. Roll the dice and strategically place monkeys to build a tower in this challenge that is played on 2 levels involving colors and motor skills. Each player creates a new tower level until it falls. The player who knocks over the tower loses.

Name: Musket Diplomacy
Description:
A Napoleonic Wars flavored multi-player campaign game for up to 6 players based on Avalon Hill's War and Peace, Blitzkrieg, and Diplomacy.
Each player is a major state on a fictional continent occupied by 5 other major states and 7 minor states.  The players have force pools from which to purchase infantry, cavalry, naval forces, and naval transports, to gain control of the continent for themselves or their alliance.

A print-and-play game with 1872 one-sided counters on a 33" x 26" map, 30 Event Cards, 12 Reinforcement Schedule Cards, 6 player cards, charts and tables, rules, and even art-work for the box you store it in, as well as a ZunTzu gamebox to play online or even solitaire without printing a thing...
all available free, at Uhlan Games:  http://UhlanGames.us

—description from the publisher

Name: Dicetopia: Roll with the Punches
Description:
Roll with the Punches is an expansion for Dicetopia that brings a whole new layer of control to the game with unchangeable Magmacorium dice, protection tokens and turn order manipulation! It also adds a new Wasteland Board with three new locations, 5 player support, short turn objectives, as well as more factions, missions and scenarios!

—description from the publisher

Name: Laura in the Magic Forest
Description:
You are a sorcerers apprentice. You send familiars to the forest to gather ressources and with them produce magic artifacts or simply extract mana from them. But other apprentices are also competing for experience: who will display the best result?

in the magic forest is a mini-worker placement game, were you sent familiars (workers) either to gain ressources or to take one of three actions. Ressources can be used one-time or continuing, depending where they are stored.

Name: Hidden Pavilions: The Maze Game
Description:
2 to 4 players enter the maze.  First to claim 4 pavilions and leave wins...but will the others catch up?

There are two sorts of double-sided maze tiles - fixed and variable.  The fixed tiles are arranged in a static pattern, the other tiles are shuffled and laid around the fixed tiles to form a 7 x 7 grid.

In your turn, you have the choice of one of 4 actions:

     roll the die and move your counter the indicated number of spaces along the path
     turn over the tile your counter is sitting on
     rotate a tile adjacent to the tile your counter is sitting on provided the path you're on leads to that tile and there is no other player's counter sitting on the tile
     move a card from elsewhere in the maze to a gap adjacent to the tile you are on provided the path you're on leads to that gap and there is no other player's counter sitting on the gap you are filling


You need to roll the exact number to land on one of the 16 available pavilions and claim the tile (this is how gaps are created). Then you must be the first player to return to the gate with 4 pavilion tiles to win (and other players will be actively trying to block you).

—user summary
